text: Viaggio continues to hit it out of the park for me.  Whether it's the friendliest people around who greet you when you first cross the threshold, or the bartenders and servers who go out of their way to take care of you, you feel like a friend the second you enter.  And it doesn't matter if your last visit was yesterday or a year ago, somehow this talented team remembers you. The food is always spot on and whether you are there pre or post a United Center event, with a big group or small, you always will have a great time at Viaggio.   On my most recent visit- they had a lobster ravioli which was terrific served with peas and shrimp as a special!  It rivaled my fav rigatoni and pork which is what I usually have there.  And the slice of key lime pie that ended my meal couldn't have been tastier.  Serve that all up with some great wine, limoncello and complimentary bread and cheese and it was a wonderful evening of food and drink. Thanks to Dave and the team for making my friends and me feel special on each and every visit.  It is much appreciated!

My card was incorrectly charged when I had dinner there last Aug 18th. My total bill including tip was $65 and my card was charged for $120. Called the restaurant on Aug 20th to straighten things out. The boss said that he'll have his finance guy fix it and they"ll call me the next day. No call yet from the restaurant after four days. Such poor customer service. Beware when using your card in this restaurant.
Dined for lunch, waiter was on point. I was disappointed due to lunch options. Will I revisit probably not, definitely not on my list for a go to restaurant for authentic Italian cuisine.

Pedestrian at best. Rigatoni with Sunday gravy was miserable from the first bite. Sauce had zero flavor and was riddled with shortcuts. Plus, as soon as you walk in, the smell of sour rag is prominent. Avoid.

We had an outstanding meal sitting outside on the sidewalk cafe. The risotto was spectacularly combined with mushrooms, sausage and sun-dried tomatoes. My sea bass was sautéed in a buttery lemon sauce topped with artichoke. The eggplant parmigiana and "West-loop chicken parmigiana" were both also spectacular. Great service and family style dining.  I highly recommend you try this place.

I've been coming here for years and the staff nor the kitchen has ever let me down. This has been one of the best restaurants ever to exist in the west loop. Impeccable and well worth the dining experience my go to restaurant now that Carmichaels is closed. A must try and hands down one of the most amazing places to be treated like you are a regular.

This place is amazing.  My favorite is their meatballs which are to die for.  And linguine bolognese.  They have outstanding fish specials as well and good desserts.  Have never been disappointed and it is very reasonably priced.  It does get loud in the restaurant if you are looking for some quiet time.  Delicious. Came back again aug 2017 and the owner remembered us from last year.  Awesome.  Had the pork Sunday gravy rigatoni and absolutely amazing!!!
Outstanding in every way.  Food and service exceded our expectations.  Cannot wait to go back.

First time at Viaggio and it couldn't have been better.  We had the stacked eggplant and meatball salad appetizers.  The meatball was one of the best anyone at the table has ever had.  For our entrees we ordered the West Loop chicken,  chicken Parmesan, rigatoni a la vodka, and the beef bolognese.  All of the food was great, as well as the service.  I would highly recommend Viaggio to anyone looking for a delicious, authentic Italian meal.

Came here craving something Italian and I was not disappointed. Through busy traffic, we arrived late to our reservation, but they were accommodating and nice enough to save it for us. Not to common of a big city restaurant to hold a reservation for more than a few minutes. The moment we sat down, we were greeted by our waiter with waters, bread, and spicy peppers. For an appetizer, we ordered the 'stacked eggplant', and oh my god was is the way to go. The eggplant was just so delicately fried or baked, I couldn't even tell, it was so lightly breaded and perfect. Accompanied by a juicy tomato, fresh mozzarella, arugula, and topped with a tangy balsamic vinegar. I was super impressed. For my entree, I ordered Rigatoni Vodka, with shrimp. The sauce was so fresh and delicious and not too large of a portion either which I liked. Most restaurants over compensate with too much mediocre food by making the portions very large, but this restaurant high quality food, with fresh ingredients. Not only did we have a terrific meal, the service here was impeccable. They were speedy, friendly, and attentive to our orders and checking up on us, I don't think any of us had an empty glass throughout our dining experience. And as we were leaving, the owners thanked us for our business. This was an amazing dining experience and the owners should be proud of their food, staff, and the experience they give. I will definitely be back. 5 well-earned stars.
Some of the best meatballs I've ever eaten.  Great food. Decent atmosphere.   Good service. The food the food the food!!!!! Yummy.

Outstanding food and service! Rigatoni with Italian sausage is delicious and so is the pork chop. Great food, laid back setting. Have been in Chicago for 3 months and have already been to Viaggio 3 times. We love it and highly recommend!

Perfectly laid back, friendly, neighborhood favorite it seems from the look of the crowd, some dining al fresco with their furkids.  Food was spectacular and I took the server up on the suggestion of house made ravioli.  Lemoncello afterwards is also made in house -yum!  So glad Yelp found this place for me! Owner is a great guy and knows how to make his guests feel right at home.  Even hailed a cab for me.  I'll def be there next visit to the area!

I came here with a group of friends. I can start by staying we had a great experience here, from when we enter and leave the place.   Our server was excellent, I give him a 10/10. He was very patient and attentive.  Every questions we had about the menu , he had an answer for. The food was just amazing. I had the Rigatoni with shrimp and vodka sauce.  Every single bit was Amazing. Best Italian food I've had so far.   Overall everything is good about this place.  The service is excellent, but the food really did it for me. I will definitely come back here again.

My must-go restaurant when I visit Chicago. Awesome food, great service. I had west loop veal with meatballs and a glass of carbenet. Had a high expectation before I come and it didn't disappoint me. Good portion of food and tasty wine.
Egg plant parmigiana was super.  The ravioli with braised beef....was fabulous with pasta executed to perfection.

Stopped in for a random date night on a Monday after reading some good reviews.  Absolute hit for me and my boyfriend! He got the carbonara and I got the rigatoni with pork belly - both were a home run! Also the caprese salad was fantastic and the creme brûlée was one of the best I've had to date. They treat you great here - don't hesitate to stop in!

I made a reservation last minute for 15 people for my friend's birthday. The person I spoke to on the phone was kind enough to make a reservation at 7:30 work despite the fact that I phoned two hours prior. When we arrived (late!) they greeted us at the door enthusiastically and told us not to worry about running late. Our waitress was fantastic and made an effort to learn the names of the two birthday girls. Some of us decided to share food, and the kitchen splits it up into two plates perfectly. I got pappardelle with vodka sauce - amazing! The noodles were perfectly chewy and the sauce was perfect. When we were getting ready to leave, our waitress, two other staff, and even the manager came out to sing happy birthday with two generous slices of amazing tiramisu! They remembered the names of our birthday girls too. Overall the food here is amazing but what really sells it for me is the excellent and thorough service they offer.

Let me start by saying - This place is special From the moment I checked out the menu on Saturday afternoon until the time we left Saturday night, this was one of our most enjoyable meals in the city. Yes I was with old friends that always have a great time together, but Viaggio made the night memorable with great food, phenomenal service and a terrific atmosphere. Even the music was perfect. The seven of us all loved our dishes and even though portions are plentiful, you just wanted to keep eating. Could not recommend or give more stars if I tried. Highlight of a reunion weekend.

Out of bounds italian food! The lemon cake was ridiculously good, but the pasta dishes were authentic and flavorful. One thing I regret is I didn't get the pork chop parmesan. It looked amazing (and it's something I've never had before). Can't wait to go back! They make you feel at home!

Came here with my boyfriend 3 times so far so I figured a review was much needed. This place has some of the best Italian food if you are in the West Loop/West Side area. The staff and owner are so down to earth and extremely friendly. We always get the West Loop, It is lightly breaded veal with Spinach, Ricotta, Tomato, Mushrooms; served with Tortellini Alfredo. LOVE!  The portions are amazing as well. Perfect amount to either split or take home for a second meal. If you are off Madison, definitely consider Viaggio!

Best salmon fillet and sauce ever! My brother loved his 4" high lasagna and my friend said the eggplant parmigiana was great! Can't wait to go back! Will be a great date night place. About 4 tables outside with perfect weather, was very relaxing.
Hands down best Italian in the city! Love this place!!! Meatball salad is a must order.
Very good restaurant with great food and service, I'll come back here for sure! Recommend the Salomon for main course

Restaurant is lovely, old school and fun. The food is a blend of sophisticated touches on old school classics. The meatballs are pillows of heaven and the fish especially is always well done. The staff is knowledgeable, helpful and attentive. Nice selection of wine... it's feels like home. Only critique is it would be nice if they varied their menu from time to time... periodically added something to reflect the season.

UBEREATS REVIEW -- I ordered the pasta with Sunday pork gravy? I forgot the actual name, but it was amazing. It was a lot better than I thought it would be... it had spice to it (Aka flavor).  I will definitely order this again!

Visiting Chicago for the first time. I was craving traditional Veal Parm.  There were several restaurants to from and I was on the phone making reservations for another restaurant when I stumbled upon this place.  It's quaint with a old school NY Italian atmosphere in the middle of a quiet neighborhood.  Definitely a sleeper.  The food was amazing!! I am a hard critic on food and even more on Italian food being the women in my family are Italian and amazing cooks. I couldn't have asked for anything more. The waiter was fun, full of life, and on top of it. The owner came over to the table several times to check on us. He was a hoot. We asked for the check and the waiter told us he needed to bring us dessert first. It was on the house.  Quite possibly the best cheesecake I've ever had in my life.

My boss and I went to Chicago for trade show and stumble upon this gem with the help of local friend. May I say I've had really good mom and pop Italian restaurants in Glendale, CA but this place is by far hands down the best pasta I've ever had.  Calamari is a must have.  Nice selection of drinks and our server could not have done better job.

My wife and I come into Viaggio on a weekly basis. We love the great variety of italian classics along with the unique specials. The staff is always fun to be around and they treat you like family. If you like Italian then you will love this Chicago staple.

Soooooooo this place is going to be a review with quite a few profanity words so please continue at your own risk. Sooooooo hubby and I stopped in today for lunch. He had the pork chop and tortellini and i had the rigatoni with sunday gravy and the meatball salad for appetizers. When i tell you Fucking Fucking ficking delicious i mean it from the bottom of my heart. We have visited some places in the city to claim to be the best and they have lied(RPM waste of good money.) I don't know who the hell they have cooking back there, but they are in fact a person who deserves a big ass hug and a big ass kiss. If you have not tried them you are missing out on a true gem. I love you guys and will return soon. From my full belly to the gifted chef hands in the kitchen. Your new customers for life.

My husband and I recently moved to the neighborhood and tried this restaurant on Friday. I'm so glad we did! It's super cute and cozy. Everything we had was delicious!  The service was amazing. They treated us like we were family. Our waiter Kyle was probably the best waiter we've ever had. This is the first time we've left a restaurant talking about how great our server was. This is our new favorite spot!
Great authentic Italian food. Great servers that explain the food in detail. Amazing pastas.

Stopped in here on a whim after a yoga class nearby. When dining alone I often sit at the bar as to not take up a table. I'm so glad I did because the bartender was so nice, she had great recommendations and made sure everything came out perfectly. I had salmon and honestly it was the best I've ever had. If you're nearby you gotta stop in, you'll love it.
Great food, great service, great atmosphere.  My go to place in the west loop

Rigatoni with Sunday pork gravy - unbelievable! The vodka sauce is amazing too. Meatballs are tender, delicious and you can taste the veal!  Ask for Julie - best server ever! She is the par excellence of serving: expressive, ebullient, and an expert in our needs!! I've never enjoyed a server more who can juggle multiple tables and make us all happy.

Still love this place.  Food is unbelievably great and service is outstanding.   Every time I go it is consistently perfect.  Can't say enough about the meatball salad and their steaks.   The desserts are awesome. The tiramisu and cheesecake are out of this world.

An excellent thin crust pizza in Chicago.  If you need a light meal and a nice glass of wine, try sharing the ham and mushroom pizza.  And yes, I used pizza and light in the same sentence - not an error.

Loved everything! This is our go to place before the bulls games and we're not the only ones. There's always tons of people with bulls gear on. The service is great and fast which is what everyone wants when you have a place to be and the food is always fantastic. If you're not in a rush, slow down on your ordering and let them know you're in no hurry because the food comes out quick. I got the rigatoni with vodka sauce after hearing some other reviews and part of me wished I saved some to bring home just so I got to lick the bowl. That was by far the best I've had. I think I'll be ordering that every time. It was a definite cheat day that I haven't stopped thinking about.
This place was pretty good. The Pesto Burrata was delicious, we had the Calamari in a pepper sauce which should have been fried a little more! I had the meat ball salad which was also good!

So after passing this place on our way to Blackhawks games and never any time we finally went! We were a walk in so we didn't think we'd get in. Well we did and it was amazing!  Our waiter Matt was outstanding and very helpful.  Since everything on the menu sounded great we had a hard time deciding. So we went with chicken marsala and Frutti di Mare. Since I cook a lot of things so on their menu we are picky. Seafood was very fresh,chicken was tender. Both had great flavor! Only defect was the marsala sauce was a little watery. I wouldn't let that stop me from ordering it again though! We finished off with tiramisu,delicious!! Definitely will be going back!! Make sure you make reservations a couple weeks in advance though because at leak times you won't get in!

I'm a rough critic when it comes to Italian cuisine. This place is fabulous and authentic. When you walk in you are greeted like they've known you for years. The food is perfect every visit. It has quite a charm to it. Definitely reserve a spot here!

I feel this place has average Italian food. The lasagna was ok, but I've had much better and the chicken parmigiana was average. Service was very good. We were not impressed enough by the food to return. I still prefer Tarantino's and Monastero's for authentic Italian food.

The service was good. We were not rushed. The pasta with meat sauce was not exceptional. The chicken Marsala was dry and overlooked. It was served with an overdressed salad and a bowl of pasta. No refills were offered on the coffee.

Really wonderful..!  Eating at Viaggio's about once a month now.  The stacked eggplant appetizer is not only innovative but melds togethers flavors and textures that in combination, DELISH..!  My sister had her usual West Loop Veal dish and remains phenomenal..!  I had a change: pasta carbonara.  I believe the reason that I'm giving it four outta five stars is because of previous carbonara dishes I've had (I lived in Brescia and the simplicity of theirs was the best).  Others I've tried were thicker, creamier (only tempered eggs used), peas, and the pancetta was diced smaller and cooked.  Viaggio's used Marsala wine (which thinned the sauce), mushrooms, onions and peas.  Ok, like I said, it's me cause this was monster flavor.  Yes, I ate ever bite.  Nuf said.  The cannoli's are to die for..!

Classic Italian restaurant in the West Loop. Fantastic service, food, and ambiance. The owner is very accommodating and made space for us in the bar after coming in without reservations. Will continue to frequent this restaurant as a local West Loop resident.

Viaggio restaurant has amazing food! My fiancé and I went on a Saturday night. This restaurant allows you to make reservations which is highly recommended. The restaurant is very small. This also lends to very loud noise level, so be prepared. The small space and noise level is easy to forget because the food is so good! We tried the fried mozzarella and calamari first. The calamari could've been a bit crispier, but the fried mozzarella was absolutely delicious. We then had the rigatoni vodka, the special risotto which was sausage and spinach, and the veal parm. The only complaint was that the veal was a bit over cooked, but the rigatoni vodka and a meatball on the side were the best Italian food I've ever had!! The risotto was absolutely delicious. For dessert we had the tiramisu, which was great. Overall the food was amazing.

I came here ahead of a Bulls game and it looked like many others were doing the same. We did not have a reservation but luckily we were seated at a high top and if not there had been seats at the bar open. If you are coming before a game, I would recommend calling ahead for a reservation because it was pretty packed. I had the Vodka Rigatoni and it was absolutely delicious. At first the portion looked small but within minutes I was quite full and had leftovers to take home. Everything looked good so I can't wait to come back and try the other pastas. The place has a very authentic and personal feel to it. We were checked on by management and staff alike. Many people seemed to be regulars and I too, felt very comfortable. We were able to walk to the United Center from the restaurant after we parked (for free!) on the street so I highly recommend!

Met up with some coworkers for dinner and had a delicious meal. Drinks were good but the food was outstanding. We shared some appetizers and then everyone ordered a meal. I had the lobster ravioli in vodka sauce. So yummy. Staff was super friendly. Parking was easy to find. Looking forward to my next trip there.
Went last night for the first time!  Wonderful food and our Server Matt was the Best!  Mediterranean Sea Bass over angel hair pasta was Amazing!

The food, service, and beverages were all outstanding! We had the chicken parmesan and linguine with clams and both cleared our plates. We had pistachio gelato that was incredible and enjoyed two complimentary limoncello shots for dessert as well. Our server Matt was knowledgeable of the menu and was a terrific server. I would highly recommend!

Kyle was awesome!!!  No frills amazing Italian food.  Great service and they make you feel right at home.  The sea bass is a must (melts in your mouth).  The manager told us it's a special but they serve it everyday in a different way.  Had the mussels, and salmon as well.  All the seafood was cooked to perfection (not over cooked).  Believe the hype!

Excellent customer service. The servers and owner really went out of their way to ensure that my friend and I had a wonderful evening. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting delicious Italian food.

Wow, what a great find. Atmosphere 5 stars, wait staff 5 stars, food 10 stars my favorite place in the city, hate to give it such good ratings, as it may get more crowded and they may start to rest on there laurels. But I just love this place. After having eaten here at least six times I can honestly say I have no complaints. Location makes for easy parking. The people that work at and frequent this establishment all add to the feel of this being a locals secret spot making it kind of a great hidden gem. In a place like chitown where the choices are many this place is at the top of my list. Please don't go there you may ruin this.......
I had the sea bass special which may have been one of the best servings of fish I have ever eaten.  We were a group of 8 and we all enjoyed a relaxing leisurely dinner.

Its 11:15 PM and I just finished my dinner that I received at 11PM for an order that was placed at 7:30PM. Now, you'd expect me to give anything but a 1 star for such a scenario, but here I am writing an honest heartfelt review at almost midnight.  Long story short - Good food and great customer service! I am a happy customer. Heres the full story - we ordered two dishes online through postmates and received our order in and hour and half. When we received the delivery - one penne pasta arabiatta and one spagetti and meatballs - , I noticed our order was incomplete (missing meatballs from our Pasta with meatballs). I was disappointed but decided to eat whatever was delivered. But as soon as i took the first bite of penne i noticed shards of paper in my dish. Now this was unacceptable to me. So I called the restaurant right away. Told them my side of the story. Dave, the GM at the restaurant was put on line and he was happy to assist (as expected). He told me that  he will refund the order but since I used postmates for delivery I would need to contact them to fix this at their end for me to receive the refund (somewhat expected and acceptable).  Then he added that he would be happy to resend the order if I could have postmates pick up. I did. So far this was all as expected (3 star- call me tough cookie, if you want). What made the real difference is the fact that when I was done getting things fixed by postmates it was already 10:25 PM. At this time I knew the restaurant was about to be closed. I still took a chance and placed the order. To my surprise, not only the order go accepted it was delivered in 30 mins, with a surprise complimentary dessert for two. Though I dont eat desserts at this time, it was a pleasant surprise.

We were a group of four that came on a Thursday night. The food was very good. Our server was friendly, and very enthusiastic. He made everything sound amazing. Our water was constantly refilled. So why only 3 stars?  Well, this wonderful meal was finished in record time. We arrived around 6:10 pm, and we left by 7:04 pm. We ordered drinks, one appetizer, four entrees, and dessert. That's three courses all served within one hour. Before we even settled in, our server asked what we wanted to drink. We quickly ordered, and our food came just as quick. The second we slowed down on our entrees, our server instantly showed up to ask us if we wanted the leftovers packed away. We figured we can just get some dessert and just chat over that. But dessert was just as rushed. We haven't gotten together for many years, and we were really looking forward to catching up. So, it was a complete let down. Honestly, the food was good, and our server was nice, but the whole experience was a disappointment. We ended up going to another place to have more desserts.

Delicious yet simple Italian food in a cozy west loop location. A bottle of Sangiovese was perfect for the roasted peppers / bread, and the rigatoni in a creamy delicious vodka sauce was definitely the highlight. Host, waiters, and bus staff were so nice and attentive. My favorite kind of service is this type of experienced care, without being salesy or unnatural. Salads and vegetable sides were perfect and customizable. Portions were ample. Do yourself a favor and get the cannoli. Can't wait to go back.

Recently moved to the West Loop and walked by this place constantly. It looked cute and welcoming, and we kept meaning to go in! Finally did last week and it did NOT disappoint! We were greeted SO very warmly, they bring out delicious seasoned peppers and bread (and offered refills) and the food was really great! The service was excellent and consistent. Our server was friendly and enthusiastic and it was all perfect! We will for sure be going back :)

It's went downhill. Used to be super tasty and authentic. Now feels like they just cram as many people as fast as they can.  Service at tables is slow. Food doesn't taste fresh or homemade like it used to.  Need to be more like it was when they opened many years ago. Too much competition now, with better food up the street, trying to serve same concept.

It's so much more fun when I hate the place! Viaggio is excellent. Nicely sized, romantic venue that also accommodates groups of 8-10 easily (even Hawks fans!). Great owners, great food, great staff. I even like the size of the drinks. I like the wine selection. The steaks are excellent. The hand-made "Eight Finger Cavatelli" is also excellent as is their signature meatball salad. That particular combination is easily enough for two and they'll split entrees upon request (added fee). They're one of the few places that doesn't overuse garlic! Even the peppers they serve as an appetizer aren't offensively over-seasoned and are very good. It's comfortable in any season but in good weather they open up the street doors, which pleases my wife because she likes the open air and makes me happy because I don't have to sit on the street (which is also available). They're usually very busy but I've never felt rushed or pushed to leave. My wife loves the risotto - not my thing. We both enjoy the tiramisu as well. It's located on Madison so there's occasionally street parking available. Side streets require a local permit. They do offer valet service. Certainly higher prices as compared to an Olive Garden but typical for city dwellers.

All in.  Absolutely delicious food, great service (thanks Nik) and just a great overall warmth.  We had a large party and we're taken very good care of across the board.  The veal I had (West Loop I think) was a nice variant with fresh tomato and ricotta.  Salads, pastas all outstanding.  And that they serve pasta as a side with entrees is appreciated.  They were nice enough to let us linger long after dinner and even brought shits of Limmincello as a gesture.   On my frequent return list!

Wow!  First time here.   Found it randomly and came before a Hawks game due to location.   Greeted like family and the service continued throughout the meal.   Gluten free choices and the food is a solid 9/10.  Highly recommend this place.   Casual or formal, come as you are.   A great find!  Go Blackhawks!
THE BEST!  Food is always impeccable and the staff is amazing! The New York Strip, WOW! Love the meatball salad and the chilian sea bass! Homemade limoncello YUM! Always our "go to" restaurant!

There's a reason Viaggio is so highly rated. For starters, the service is impeccable. We were always checked on but without it being too much. Next, the food. The flavors of each dish were on point. I got the Rigatoni with Sunday Pork Gravy and my husband got the Chicken Parmesan with a side of Tortellini Alfredo. That alfredo sauce, man, I'm salivating just thinking about it! For dessert, we split a cannoli which was light and fresh. To top it off, the atmosphere was lively with a local feel. We will definitely be back!
The food here is just amazing. Gotta try the meatball salad. That marinara sauce is something else, mixed with the tangy vinaigrette of the salad and maybe just a little parmigiano, yum!!

Oh man love it here! And I live really close now. Sure it gets a little rowdy on a Friday night but go here to have a fun time! The service is excellent and the food is as good as advertised. The meatball salad is the BEST! I will definitely Be back

Viaggio offers a quaint atmosphere and true Italian cuisine. The meatball salad is a must-try. It's unique - the sauce from the meatballs mixes pleasantly with the lettuce to form a perfect dish.   Our waiter, Matt, gave the four of us free limoncello shots as well as free tiramisu (granted the comped tiramisu could have been an oversight in the bill I'd like to think not).   If you're into friendly and personalized service as well as old world Italian, make a resi at Viaggio.

Great service! First great thing about this place, they take reservations from you like normal people, not through a whole event planner?? [First time hearing from a friend, that lives in Chicago, that you have to go through an event planner to make reservations. What the heck? Event planner is making some easy money for sure though.] Our server, Julie, was patient, friendly, and attentive.    We were that annoying table of 10 that comes in one by one and orders at all different times. Good thing for the servers, but bad for customers is that they don't allow separate checks and only allow 1 bill per table.  Complimentary bread, parmesan, olive oil, peppers! Yummmm... I was good with just eating that.  Lasagna, was good and the texture part was cooked perfectly, but unfortunately, the taste was a little sour for me. My other friend who ordered it, loved it though! Tried my friends Chilean Bass with pasta, now that was amazing though.  So sweet of them to sing to my friend and bring out a complimentary Tiramisu for her birthday.  Overall good experience.

Outstanding Italian- as good as Grandma's in South Philly!  We were treated with fresh roasted peppers, olive oil, bread and cheese on arrival. Calamari appetizer was crisp, lightly coated and tender.  Lobster ravioli were incredible, and topped with another 6 ounces of prime lobster, in a light white sauce.  Sea bass (with lump crab and asparagus on angel hair pasta, in a lemon-wine sauce) was possibly the most flavorful and tender fish that I have ever had at a restaurant.  The tiramisu was delicious, but the crime brûlée was absolutely perfect.  The atmosphere is modern and comfortable, and service was excellent--competent and unobtrusive.  Fantastico!
What a delight! Delicious and fresh. Friendly and efficient service. Good price point for the area. We will be back.

Love everything about this place. The staff is very attentive and friendly, the food is really good and it is not overpriced like nearby establishments. The lunch specials are fabulous, try the veal marsala!!! Top notch dining.

Very big and tasty piece of lasagna! I haven't had a lasagna in what seems like forever, but it was well worth the wait. Marinara sauce was very flavorful and hearty. Next I'll try the rigatoni w/sunday pork gravy.

Delicious!  We had their special appetizer of the night -- burrata, prosciutto and arugula served with grilled bread.  Seriously awesome.  Entrees were shrimp and broccolini and the carbonara.   Shrimp were not high quality, but the flavor and the quality of the other ingredients in the dish made up for it for me.   Carbonara was perfect.  Great date night spot!
The Chicken Parm is outstanding!  The Creme Brûlée was very good as well.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

I really wanted to love Viaggio, esp. after reading so many glowing reviews. But, alas, I'm left with the feeling that folks in the West Loop must not realize that Little Italy is but a stone's throw away. Much better food can be enjoyed over on Taylor Street in any number of restaurants.  Ambiance - upscale and loud, with lots of hard surfaces which do not soak up sound at all. Food - meh, except for the excellent shrimp appetizer. The veal parmesan was a gloppy mess. The lasagna was relatively tasteless and had a very odd, homogeneous texture. The bolognese gravy was subpar. Service - barely fair. Our waiter seemed only tangentially interested in anything having to do with his job. The rest of the staff was friendly and more or less attentive. We felt rushed as the entrees were served when we were halfway through with the appetizer. My spouse was not happy with the dessert but the waiter never checked back with us and merely dumped the check on the table without a backward glance. Value - if the food had been outstanding I would have said OK, but it was way overpriced for the quality We will not bother going back to this place, considering that there are so many better options both in the W. Loop and elsewhere.

I thought Viaggio was quite delicious.  We visited with friends on a Friday evening and were seated inside quickly.   The servers were really friendly and helpful with recommendations and servers were efficient, but also didn't rush us at all (we were talking and couldn't decide on orders).   I tried the meatball and also had penne with vodka sauce.  It was very very delicious.  The meatballs were huge and perfect - nicely juicy and perfectly cooked with a great flavor.  The pasta was wonderful - cooked well and portioned nicely (not too huge as at some restaurants).    I wanted to order 10 more meatballs - I can't wait to eat them again.  Leftover on a bun...yum!   Also, excellent house made limoncello! Definitely worth a visit.  Inside is what I would call an atmosphere of traditional Italian (a little bright) and they also have a little patio outside for when the weather is nice.   Food - 5 Service - 5 Atmosphere - 4 Value - 5 Bathrooms - 5

This place is a staple for the area.  The owner is awesome and the staff rocks.  The food is some of the best Italian in the city. Love the peppers that come with the bread and I love the meatball salad. Keep up the great work and definitely recommend this place if you are looking for great food with great staff and a great atmosphere.

Viaggio never disappoints. Has all of the traditional Italian dishes and they nail them all. Some of my faves are the eggplant or chicken parmesan. Carbonera pasta is amazing and the breaded mozzarella app. If you're up for something a little different then get the meatball salad.  The wait staff and owners are super nice. I've never once had a bad experience at viaggio. Pricing is a bit higher than most Italian places but your paying for quality. They do it right. Great date spot or place to go with the family! Walking distance to United Center of you're looking for a nice sit down dinner before a game or concert.

Really good Italian for a reasonable price! I've walked past it a hundred times and finally was able to try it tonight. It did not disappoint. Would definitely recommend the meatball salad (sounds weird but SO good, the moistest meatball I've ever eaten) and the homemade cavatelli with vodka sauce! Yum!

Blend amazing food and a great atmosphere with warm caring staff and now you have the experience Everyone made us feel like family they have been waiting for and want us to have the best meal ever The warmth is everyone  Even the people who clear your dishes  Thank you for making this an outstanding meal with warm wonderful people My new favorite  And lots of regulars which also tells the story Julie took care of us I can't say enough she is terrific
Great food and amazing service. Their meatball salad was to die for! I booked a party of 14 for my birthday and our experience was outstanding!

Had the 16oz  steak. And mashed potatoes. Was excellent. The whole staff. From the bartender and both our waiters. We're exceptionally nice, and seemed to enjoy working there. And made our visit very pleasant. Came out here  for a friend's birthday.   They brought her a surprise cake at the end on their own, which was nice. Would definitely Come back!!

We had high expectations based on the yelp reviews, but we were disappointed. We had mussels to start with and they were ok, nothing special. Hubby had steak special which was amazing and I had a fish which was mediocre and tasted a little fishy. We ended with tiramisu, which was decent. The service was ok until we got a check half way through the tiramisu, no offer of coffee. I booked the table in advance, spend $160 and I hate to feel rushed out after 45 min, when half of the restaurant is empty. We will not be back and I wouldn't recommend this place.
Fantastic service and amazing food. Their lasagna is the best in town. You won't be disappoint if you are looking for authentic Italian.

First off, I'd like to shout out to the manager for being super flexible with our group. I made reservations for 6 way in advance and added a 7th person a few days before our reservation. Even though they were full for the night, they reassured me that they'd figure it out. The day of the event, my graduation ran long and we kept pushing the reservation back but they were super nice about it. When we arrived an hour later, our table was ready for us!  The food itself was pretty good. We got 6 dishes for 7 ppl and had almost an entire dish left over. So def recommended to share! The chicken parm was my favorite. The cavatalli was undercooked for our liking. Everything else was pretty average. It all taster good, but not all that mind blowing.  For dessert we got the kaluha cake, tiramisu and creme brule. The tiramisu and creme brule were great but the kaluha cake was too sweet and kind of dry. Skip.  Overall, cute place, reasonably priced and worth checking out!

All I can say is -- wow!  Was looking for someplace to go in the west loop. We frequent high-end Italian restaurants (RPM, Rosebud...) and I have to say that this was as good, if not better than any of them. I started with a special appetizer, Burratta with roasted tomatoes on garlic toast...the flavor was amazing. There were 4 of us and we all were extremely happy with our meals. I had the lemon chicken..it was sautéed perfectly and the lemon sauce was amazing. The cheesecake with chocolate ganache on top was the best I have ever had. Don't be put off by location or the fact that there are available reservations on a Saturday night. GO!

We live in Ukrainian Villiage and have some of the best Italian restaurants right near us (e.g. A Tavola and Briciola).  So when I Yelped to find another good place to go on a Saturday night when we had no reservations, we decided to mute our expectations about this Italian place that had an overall 4.5 star rating.  After all, we had experienced some highly places that were in more insular neighborhoods that were just ... okay. We were wrong!  This place is terrific!  The service was both polite and efficient.  Food came fast and hot.  And that food was plentiful. Our pasta special was unstuffed ravioli with homemade  ground sausage and spinach in a garlic and some sort lightly hot pepper sauce.  It was delicious and different from any we've had before.  Yum! Our other entree was a standard: Piccante Chicken.  The dish was breaded grilled  chicken with pine nuts in a lemon sauce.  It was grilled to perfection and the sauce accented the meat without any over-powering sourness. We also had a side grilled with a bit of parmesan. But was still crunchy. We were too stuffed for dessert.  ...Hopefully, next time.

Pasta was very average definitely not home made. The whole experience was very disappointing I've been wanting to try this place for ages, but all three of the mains my group ordered were sub par. Had the rigatoni that everyone was raving about and it was NOT that great

I agree there's nothing better then or owner/management greeting you at the door. I had a late arrival, sat at the bar and was impressed by the employment teamwork and personal candor. I ordered the mussels which were overcooked.  I did tell the bartender which got an apology and nothing else.  But I did enjoy my visit, will go back to the bar where most regulars sit, I just wont order the seafood.
This place is marvelous!!!! Shout out to my man Dave! They make the steaks to perfection. Bring back the lobster mashed potatoes!
Had the brick chicken. AMAZING!  Staff and owner were super attentive and friendly. Highly recommended.

Service and food was amazing! Bruschetta was delicious. We had chicken picante and lasagna and it was wonderful. Our server Eddie was super friendly and all the other was staff were extremely attentive and friendly. I highly recommend.

Nicholas did an outstanding job at greeting us, and then describing the specialties and entrees. His suggestion of enhancing an entree was appreciated. His enthusiasm of the entrees elevated our enjoyment of them. Delicious food, superb waitstaff. Comfortable, authentic Italian cuisine. Thank you, Nicholas and Viaggio, for a wonderful dining experience!
Another uber eats order. Was almost great. Except the best part of my chicken sandwich was missing...the pancetta! The chicken breast was juicy but lacking a bit of flavor. Pancetta was needed.

Everything was great. Meatball Salad..... great Calamari.....great Eggplant Parm.......great Chicken Marsala.....great Service.....great I don't get back to Chicago that much but Viaggio is always at the top of my list!!!

I went to viaggio a few days ago after a long time.. I was very surprised that the food quality seemed to have changed.. I didn't enjoy my lasagne, it didn't have that excellent quality I'd come to associate with V. It looked different too from what I remembered. The drink I had was excellent though and the waitress very friendly. The dessert was ok. But I'm just surprised and sad that my favorite Italian restaurant in the city seemed to have overall taken a bit of a downturn..

Went there because there was a Chicago magazine article about it awhile back. Started with the Meatball salad which the three of us shared and it was more than enough for an appetizer. Very good and had a hint of lemon that was surprising. I had the risotto special with asparagus and shrimp. It was delicious and filling. I only finished half. My mom had the arribiatta and my sister had the rigatoni special and they both liked them. We got there at 6 and were surprised at how many kids were there, but around 7 they were all pretty much gone. So I guess go early with kids and if you want the more intimate experience go after 7. They have a fully stocked bar and they had a few things on the dessert menu that looked good but I was way too full for that. I also have to comment on the amazing service. Our waiter never made us wait and the bus staff went above and beyond.  I don't think my glass ever went under half and dirty dishes were whisked away as soon as we were done with them. I am definitely going to return!

Came here 4/8 /16 for an anniversary dinner with my girlfriend and made sure to make reservations. We were about 10 minutes late but we still got seated within 5 minutes on a Friday night.  The overall feel is definitely a tight packed Italian environment. This place is quite small so we were somewhat crammed between two tables. Slightly uncomfortable but we were hoping for the best. We ordered the bruschetta as an appetizer which was very good(8/10).  For entrees I ordered the chicken vesuvio and my girlfriend ordered the parmesan chicken. Both dishes were absolutely amazing(10/10). It was prepared perfectly and displayed well. I ate my entire plate and my girlfriend took leftovers.  I'd definitely return here for another date night in the future!
Delicious chicken Marsala! Very friendly wait staff and an enjoyable atmosphere! Perfect local Italian joint to visit!
Loved this place. Awesome service. Manager even saw we were waiting for the weather to lighten up and called a cab for us.

The best eggplant Parmesan I have had. (Period). Ambience was excellent! (I came solo and sat at the bar) Just outside the main streets of downtown to a quaint location with timely service and the overwhelming feeling of "you're family."
The food was pretty good, but not exceptional.  The restaurant was very loud and the tables are smashed together.
Motherfuckers know what's up. Solid everytime, will come back for everything on the menu.

Excellent!  I've been looking for another tasty Italian restaurant.  I created my own pasta.  Linguine with alfredo sauce, sweet peas, wild mushrooms and shrimp.  Oh so delicious!  The garden salad was also very good.  Pair it off with a glass of Malbec red wine.  I will be returning to this restaurant very soon.  Be sure to make a reservation.

I'm all for a neighborhood spot - but not when others aren't welcome. I felt like I was taken into a time warp where only middle aged men were supposed to be out dining. Our waitress had one too many tables or too many men to chat with. We had to ask for or server for every step in our dinner - it was a big bummer. I also woke up with a stomach ache at 4am presuming it was from dinner here.

Food was great, service was not. Had to flag down our waitress every time we needed something, even had to walk the bill over to her. Came here because of the reviews here on yelp, and left disappointed with the experience. If your looking for a date night setting there are far better options in the city.

I didn't like my service here and I thought the food was good but basic. I don't think I would return. I had the ravioli with vodka sauce added chicken which added on 8 dollars for jus a few pieces of chicken. My boo had the pasta carbonara which was good but not amazing. My server only saw us when we ordered and that's it. Even when we asked for our check he didn't ask to wrap up our food or if we wanted dessert. Just not good service. The place is cramped and not a romantic Italian spot if that's what your looking for.

The food is good here, but the service is okay at best. I had the Parmesan Veal which was cooked well. The service was poor, the food came out at a decent time but I felt like when it came to ordering drinks I couldn't find the waitress, or when it was time to pay the check.

This place is awesome! The service, the food. Large portions and great tasting. My girls had the spaghetti marinara, wife the chicken limone,  I had the risotto special. We finished with some cheesecake and gelato. Nice bottle of red wine and our server brought us a comp limoncello. Highly recommended!

This spot's reputation preceded my visit and I was not disappointed.  For me, nothing is better than ownership / management giving a personal hello. Super friendly and efficient staff. I ordered the grilled seafood which was perfectly prepared and light. My friend ordered an off the  menu Seabass which was great. Without question I will be back.
Some of the best Italian food I've had in the city!  Love taking my family here when they come into town to visit!

If I could give 10 stars I would!  This is by far the best Italian restaurant in the city I have ever been to, it blows away any of the rosebud restaurants! Service was amazing, the bartender as great and they give a very nice pour in the wine.  Our waiter was also great, he made the meal very enjoyable. They start out with roasted sweet peppers on the table, they almost tasted like the sweet peppers you would have on an Italian beef sandwich. We all tried different dishes, one was better than the next and their red sauce was amazing! The owner was up front and really seem to care that everything was good!   Would highly recommend this restaurant, may be hard to get in when the Hawks or bulls are in town so make a reservation early! Can't wait to return!

Decided to go to Viaggio after reading reviews.  Restaurant located 5 minutes from the United Center, a great place for dinner before a concert, Bulls or Black Hawks game.  Needed a place to dine before a concert at the United Center, and this was the perfect choice.  Delicious food, great service, food and drinks served quickly no problem making the concert on time. Highly recommend this restaurant, if possible make reservations especially if you have tickets to an event....not a huge space.

We first heard about this place on Check, Please! and started with the meatball salad they recommended. It comes with two extra large meatballs that taste amazing and can easily be split between four people. My wife had the eggplant stack for dinner, which was delicious. I had their seasonal fish (which I can't remember the name of) dish which absolutely blew me away. The staff is incredibly friendly, the bar is nicely stocked, and there's a good wine list. This place isn't cheap, but the food, staff, and ambiance make this place worth every cent.
I'm having my favorite meal at one of my favorite restaurants in West Loop.  I've reviewed before so I won't go into great detail.

I have been here at least 5 times plus had take out a few times. Every time I go I realize how awesome this place is. The complimentary warm red peppers in olive oil with the fresh bread is always a great start. I always get the meatball salad as a starter and it does not disappoint.  The massive meatballs are probably the best I have ever had.  I have had numerous pasta and chicken dishes and all are great.  One of my favorites is the Rigatoni with Sunday Pork Gravy. It is delicious. I have also had their Manhattan cocktail and it was delish and probably the biggest manhattan I have ever had.  Overall this is one of my favorite Italian restaurants and in my opinion probably the best one in the west loop.

It's not often that I am immediately impressed the minute I walked in the door but Viaggio was truly one of those moments. We were greeted warmly the second we walked in. This was appropriate since we had just been standing around in some freezing ass weather. Our group was pretty disgruntled after the West End sports bar next door treated us like crap. We only had time for some quick snacks and drinks before the Bulls game since we wasted a good 30 minutes next door.   We were served immediately after discussing our ordeal and they even apologized in their neighbors behalf which was unnecessary at this point. We got our drinks promptly and they even tried to find a game for us to watch while we sat at the bar. I mentioned we'd love to try their meatballs but not sure if we had time and before we could even turn back to the bar the meatballs were brought out to us.  They were some of the best meatballs we had all had so the 8 of us proceeded to order another round of drinks and balls.  I really hope I get to come back to Chicago soon to and really sit down and hang out with my new friends at Viaggio for a full dinner. If it's anything like their hospitality their food should be out of this word.

I'm so happy with this New Year's Eve dinner choice. A bustling little Italian joint offering authentic dishes better than grama made them (but don't actually admit that!). My top recommendation would be the meatball salad!
I've been here 3-4 times and it's always superb--the best Italian food in town in my opinion.  This is where I take my friends from out of town when they want Italian.
Viaggio is a great, old-school Italian restaurant. Some of the best chicken parm I have ever had.

Let me start off by saying that I am Italian and come from a huge Italian family that used to hold Sunday dinners every night for the first fifteen years of my life.. So I know good Italian food! I feel like with Italian food, you have to establish some credibility!! Now, let me re start off by saying I've never actually had the dine in experience at the restaurant. A friend of ours is working at viaggios and brought over some meatballs he got at the restaurant. He casually asked if I wanted to try the meatball. I accepted and was mind blown! It brought me right back to the Sunday dinner table, so much so that I actually felt bad not saying mass before taking the bite.  If I were him, I would actually consider being paid in meatballs! "Fix that flooring" ... -- "that'll be twenty meatballs"!

A cozy space for casual Italian dining.  Excellent food and service.  We were there for a pre-Bulls meal and the pace was perfect, quick but not rushed.  I will return since there were many dishes I would like to try.  I had the Sea Bass w Vesuvio style potatoes.  The light sauce was flavored with roasted garlic.  Delicious!

Make it happen.  I have been here twice, each time was a treat.  Its a nice little place, usually fairly crowded.  There is a bar with a TV alone the west wall, plenty of tables... and a good menu.  you can get many of your Italian-american faves, and a few that are a little more adventurous and great!   They give you delicious bread and peppers with your entire meal, and allow BYOB. In all, I have liked it and will keep coming back for a good value.

Excellent! After reading so many good reviews our expectations for a great meal were high and Viaggio did not disappoint. Beautiful bar runs along one wall and the dining room is intimate with another dining area in the back. Service was excellent and the food even better. Meatball salad was very good, meatballs incredibly tender. Rigatoni Vodka, Spaghetti & meatballs and Brick Chicken were all worth writing home about. Desserts were huge and definitely for sharing.  We've already told several friends about the place and encouraged them to try it.  It's quite close to the United Center so would be a great pre-game dinner spot.  We are looking forward to going back soon!

Without a doubt, the best Italian restaurant in Chicago!! The food is incredible ... meatball salad is to die for (I know it sounds weird but just try it), burrata with balsamic roasted tomatoes and crustini is the perfect starter and all of the entrees (meats & pasta) are filling and delicious (my favorite is the eggplant parm). Not only is the food exceptional but the service makes you feel like part of the family! I LOVE THIS PLACE and you will too!!

Love the non-ritzy ambiance and class at Viaggio. Meatball salad is amazing. Was there for lunch and was very pleased with my grilled chicken sando.  Can't wait to come back to try the lasagna, have heard great things.

This place was delicious. We came here to celebrate my brother's birthday. We had 10 people and I had made the reservations from a week ago. I had made changes to the amount of people at least 3x and they were so accommodating and nice. Given that the restaurant gets super busy on a Saturday night during prime dining hours, our food came out promptly and hot. I got the rigatoni Vodka and so delicious, tasted authentic. I can't wait to go back and eat it again or try other dishes. Side note, we did get charged $3 for a sharing fee, but he gave us $21.00 complimentary desserts so I guess it evened out. The Tiramsu and the salted caramel gelato is like heaven. 5 thumbs up guys, can't wait to come back again!

Absolutely 100% yes. This is hands down the best Italian restaurant I have ever had the privilege to dine at. The service, top notch. The ambience, top notch. The menu, top notch. The food, TOP. NOTCH.  Visited Viaggio's before a night at the lyric opera. It certainly set the pace for the remainder of the night. Very bourgeois. There was a bread bowl with olive oil and herbs for us to munch before ordering the appetizer: the meatball salad. Okay. Seriously? That meatball was the best ball I've ever had in my mouth. Like, extremely moist, melted in my mouth, seasoned to perfection, actually somewhat of a kick. Perfection. I would never have imagined pairing meatballs with tomato gravy with greens. But it worked. Seriously, it is worth the price.  I ordered the pork chop Parmesan. This dish was pricy but for good reason. I had no idea it was going to be as massive as it was. I mean it was actually bigger than the plate. The pork was juicy, tender, seasoned perfectly, smothered with fresh mozz and tomato gravy. It was served with creamy tortellini. The tort wasnt hot, but it was still delicious. Made from scratch pasta is the way to go!

Went here for dinner on a Friday night after getting a last minute reservation on OpenTable and reading the great reviews on Yelp.  I was torn between 3 and 4 stars for this place. The service was 5 stars: our waiter was friendly, helpful, and attentive and the owner stopped by to ask how we were doing. The food was definitely good, but we were not blown away. We had the meatball salad and the lasagna. Perhaps Yelp made our expectations too high, but those two dishes were nothing to write home about (and were quite expensive). We also did not like the atmosphere; it was quite loud and cramped; I suppose some people like this style of dining room, but I prefer something quieter and fancier along the lines of Vivo.  Overall, definitely give Viaggio a try. You may love it like the rest of Yelp; I'm not sure, however, that I will be back given that there are so many other restaurants in the city, and Viaggio did not quite meet my admittedly high expectations.

I'm not sure why people are raving about this place. The meatball should be called a dumpling it had so much bread crib in it. Yes it's tender, but only because it's 70% breadcrumbs! Sauce was super salty. I'll pass there's much better Italian in Chicago than this.

This was mine and my boyfriends first time at Viaggio. We came from Milwaukee to see the Weeknd in concert & when we got there we were seated right away. Our waitress was very nice and very funny! I ordered the cheese ravioli and my boyfriend ordered the lobster ravioli with truffle sauce. We figured it'd be a while before we got our food because it was so busy, but not at all the waitress came out with it within minutes! Let me tell you, along with my ravioli and my boyfriends, this is by far the best homemade Italian food I have ever eaten in my life!!!!! Not only is this the best Italian food this is the friendliest most welcoming restaurant I've been to. Great service and exceptional food, I would highly recommend going, worth the drive. & I can't wait to return.

This place is awesome!! Get the meatball salad it's the most delicious thing ever. The owner is phenomenal, makes you feel like family in 2 seconds. Service staff is beyond amazing. Limoncello martini is fabulous! Never disappointed here!

Meatballs make the world a better place. Viaggio's meatballs make the world a Playboy Mansion party. They're easily on my "Top Things To Eat" list anytime someone asks me what to indulge on in Chicago. Seriously...if you're from out of town skip Lou Malnati's and just order this place's Meatball Salad.  Along with old school Italian hospitality and made from scratch pasta and sauces this place puts me in a food coma from a delicious overdose every time. Keep up the great work you guys.
The food is terrific, fresh and delicious. The decor is lovely, and the staff was friendly and efficient. Everyone in our party was thrilled with their meals and we can't wait to go back.

First off, prior to ever eating here I did NOT eat meatballs. Meatballs were just not my thing... I know strange.. everyone loves meatballs, especially at an Italian restaurant. My cousin and I stopped in for a quick bite midday and I order the Calamari and she ordered the 'Meatball Salad'.... I didn't even ask her what it was due to the word 'meatball'. She got full quite fast and the scavenger I am, went in for the kill and actually tried the meatball and liked it. Actually.. LOVED it is the truth. The meatball was seasoned well, not overcooked, it was by far my new favorite dish.. in the world. The Meatball Salad is so tasty, you can get it as a 'starter' prior to your main dish, or as your main dish. Whatever floats your boat really... but I highly suggest trying the amazing 'Meatball Salad' if you ever venture out in the West Loop... perhaps test it out before a Hawks game?! :)
The Bolognese sauce is amazing. I ordered takeout and the penne Bolognese was great when I got home. The portion was enough for two. It came with a side of bread and roasted peppers.
This was my second time at this restaurant.  Service was mediocre and so was the food. There are so many restaurants that you can go for this price with much more flavorful food.

I came here twice now. The food is very delicious both time. The service is very friendly and fast. The first time I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass. It is delicious! The portion is very generous. But I would try to improve on the presentation. The second time I ordered stacked eggplants and a chicken parmesan. Again they are both fantastic. By the way, they have a chilled glass for beer! Also there is a ice cream shop called "Cone Gourmet Ice Cream" nearby that you should check it out. It's within a walking distant.

Viaggio was delicious and the wait staff was amazing. I went with my mom and sister and we all got a different delicious pasta dish. They made sure we were happy the entire meal and the owner walked to different tables to greet people, which is always nice. I will definitely go again when I'm craving italian.

We went to Viaggio for the first time before a Saturday night Blackhawks game. We could not have made a better choice! Reservations were super easy online and they seated our party of six right away. It's very tight on space inside but that's to be expected at a downtown Chicago eatery before a Hawks game. The food was absolutely amazing. The people raving about the meatball salad aren't exaggerating. Not sure if I have ever tasted a better salad dressing! All of our pasta was incredible and the service was impeccable. Everyone, from the owner, who personally stopped by our table to check on us, to our server treated us like family and welcomed guests. Top things from this visit that were awesome besides the food: 1) Rather than pay $30-40 to park at the United Center, they have $12 valet parking at Viaggio. You can leave your car there through the whole game and take the free shuttle bus that they share with West End Grill over to the game. What an awesome deal. Tip the valets well. They work hard! 2) We had leftovers we wanted to keep but we were heading to the game. Our waiter offered to put them in the fridge for us at the restaurant for us to pick up after the game. Such a nice gesture. I cannot recommend this place more highly if you are looking for dinner before or after a Hawks game, Bulls game, or concert at the UC!
Loved it! We had the meatball salad and it truly was something unexpected!!! The dressing was so flavorful.  Honestly it was an awesome dinner :)

we followed the reviews online and ordered the meatball salad and pork chop sunday gravy the meatball is different that i originally anticipated, it is  not as juicy or flavourful, but nonetheless it is still very good. I espeically liked the greens and dressing, it is not just some veggie they throw together to make a salad, the dressing is very refreshing and greens very fresh the pork is very tender and great texture, highly recommend  portions are huge we especially liked the owner would drop by to see how we enjoyed everything, very tentative. the environment is very cozy, would definitely come back to try other dishes

It does not get any better then this in the Windy City.  Viaggios is a couple blocks down the street from the United Center. The food is amazing but the overall customer experience is what you will be coming back for.  Robert took great care of us during our time there.  The servers were very helpful and provided great info on each of their specials.  My friend got the meatball salad to start and then the Chilean Sea Bass and I had the rigatoni and meatballs.  Everything was off the hook crazy good.   We are already trying to figure out how we can get back there tomorrow.

Oh my goodness is this place the best! I wish I lived here so I could come all the time but in my short 4 day trip I came twice!!!!! Nicholas was the best server and the food was to die for!!! I got the fettuccini Alfredo and added chicken and it's the best fettuccini I've ever had! I cleaned my plate every time'! We had a lemonchello and the V Cosmo and were in love, definitely a must try. But goodness is this place delicious!! Can't rain to come back to Chicago to get more! A must stop.
Amazing food and service. We came in two days in a row. Nicholas was our server both days and he is just simply amazing! Will definitely come back when I am in town.

We were in town visiting our daughter who is attending college here and wanted to have a good, reasonably priced Italian dinner in a place with a warm, comfortable atmosphere.  We selected Viaggio due to the other recommendations and were not disappointed.  First, I must highlight that the service was exceptional.  The three of us shared the fried calamari and stacked eggplant appetizers, and the orechietta (with sausage/beans) and pappardelle (with shrimp/broccolini) pasta main dishes and our server divided/plated them all for us.  Both the appetizers were wonderful, although the eggplant was especially good.  The pasta dishes were also very good.  We shared a crème brulee dessert (also wonderful) and then enjoyed the limoncello (definitely worth it).  The ambience is great.  Overall, you can't go wrong here.

This review is LONG overdue. This is my absolute favorite restaurant in the city of Chicago.  I would say my husband and I come here at least 2-3 times a month for dinner, drinks, dessert or appetizers. We never leave without having their meatball salad, a dirty martini with blue cheese olives, and a shot of their house limoncello to end the night. I can't forget about the house peppers - I can eat them every single day.  We live in the neighborhood and this restaurant is truly a gem. We have a hard time leaving the neighborhood to try new places because I KNOW we'll have a great meal at Viaggio.  Nico, Matt, Kristin, the WHOLE Viaggio team make you feel like you're a part of their family. We have been celebrating birthdays, anniversaries, and special occasions there for the last couple of years. We celebrated NYE 2015 and got engaged there in a surprise proposal that the staff helped my husband create.  I can't say enough good things - BEST meatball salad, BEST dirty martini, BEST limoncello, BEST Italian restaurant in the city, by FAR. It's impossible to be disappointed.

We stopped in on Saturday night after a Blackhawks' game for a couple of drinks. If the quality of the food is anything like the quality of the staff, this will be a great place to eat. The only reason it doesn't get a 5th star yet is because we haven't eaten here yet. That will be on our agenda soon.
AMAZING!!! So happy I finally tried it. The food is beyond delicious. Our server was very knowledgeable, and the wine list did not disappoint.  Highly  recommended!

Great location, very elegant setting, great food and presentation, great service and the food is just amazing to die for this is the Italian food I come to Chicago for. And you will come back for it too.

First of all, we were 15 minutes late for our reservation because of traffic,  we called and they were so understanding which is always a good sign.  They  start with the warm peppers and crusty bread on the table when you arrive . So yummy!  We ordered the appetizer special, sweet peppers stuffed with sausage and sweet onions.  Amazing!  The rest of the meal was also great!  I got the orchietta (I probably spelled that wrong) pasta with sausage crumble.  The portion was huge and so filling.  I don't think I finished even half of it!  For dessert you have to order the cheese cake, fluffy, creamy, crunchy crust, chocolate ganache on top, amazing!  The limoncello was the best I have ever had, hands down.  The service was outstanding .  If you're lucky Nick will be your waiter, friendly, fun, and great suggestions.  The owner or the manager (I'm not sure which he was) checked in with every table, very hospitable and charming.  We chose this restaurant because it was close to the United Center, but we'll be back because of the experience!

Saturday night 6:00 - they fit us in as their last reservation just 2 hours before.  Seated immediately, restaurant was full but staff was attentive & informative.  We were celebrating 2 birthday's and heading to the UC for a show at 7:30.  Advice about portion sizes was informative - we probably ordered same amount as a table of 4 ordering 1 entree each - but because everything was split - we had a lot of variety to choose from.  Adults liked the meatball salad; kids did not.  Kids loved the spaghetti carbonara.  And the chicken parmesian was good too. The apple torte with gelato was delicious.  Fast, affordable, very nice.  And the visit at the end of our meal (from I think the owner(s)) was also a very nice touch!

This is family style traditional Italian at its best. Be prepared for huge portions and friendly bubbly service. The three of us ordered: calamari (awesome) brick chicken (it is a whole chicken) veal marsala (if you're not starving, the thin veal would be perfect for you, with yummy shrooms) bottle of pinot grigio All in a little over $153 and absolutely no room for dessert and everyone doggy bagged a portion of our meal. The table was on the small side and it was a bit of a struggle managing all of the plates with a couple of close calls knocking over wine glasses. We managed but it would have been nice if there was a bit more room to spread about.

Superb Italian restaurant. Staff are professional and courteous. Our mains came a little late as our check was "misplaced". We didn't care as the apps were filling and delicious. The waiter gave us a free desert for the delay - that's how to run a business. Great crowd too - families, couples, friends. Will be back often.
For years and years......still the best food and service in the city, hands down. A model for how independent businesses can thrive.

Green peppers and warm bread are brought to your table after you sit down. We chose to dip the bread in oil and vinegar (you have to request vinegar), but the bread tastes good enough to eat alone.  The waiter was very kind and took time to answer our many questions.  For my meal, I got the chicken Caesar salad and nibbled on my boyfriend's spaghetti with marinara sauce and meatballs. The amount of pasta could probably feed two, and the regular sized salad could probably feed two people as well -- I basically waddled out of the place from so much food. Although I only drank water, I noticed many people enjoying a wide variance of alcoholic beverages. The dessert menu had some nice options including gelato and creme brûlée, but I couldn't stand to eat another bite so I did not try.  I'd make reservations if you plan on eating during "normal" dining hours. My party arrived at 4:45 with no reservation and seated immediately, but people began coming very quickly and I'm sure you'd find a wait of you came much later.

I was craving Italian food then found this gem near by me. Soon as I walked in the hostess was very sweet and said it was ok for me seat at the bar when I asked. Eddie took care of me and suggested the meatballs and salad was amazing and I had pasta with arabiatta sauce. Everything was great. The owner Dave also introduced himself and it was very friendly and caring about how everything was. I can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu. Everyone was so welcoming and nice great service and food. Recommend.

Tried out Viaggio for lunch on a Friday, and it was absolutely delicious! We had a meatball sub, chicken parmigiana, and the rigatoni with sunday pork gravy. Highly recommend all three.  Our server, Felipe, was outstanding and very personable. Overall the food was delicous, perfectly spiced and balanced in flavors. I will definitely become a repeat customer.  The lunch menu provides some amazing value as the food is easily worth the price and left all 3 of us full for the rest of the day.  Definitely a 5 star place in my view!

I really liked this place. It wasn't the greatest gluten free Italian menu I've ever seen but the food was great and the server was conscious of contamination. My fb said his meal and bread was good as well.

Great little Italian restaurant with outstanding, personable service and good old fashioned Italian dishes. We got meatball salad and a variety of pasta dishes and it was all really good. The meatballs and the pappardelle with vodka sauce were my top 2. This place is a nice alternative to all the over the top celebrity type restaurants in the area. Just simple, good food.

Really nice Italian resturant.Service was great.Wine well priced.We had a nice Chianti.My wife had veal scallopini and I had a seafood special with mussels,shrimp and calamari.There was so much seafood that it was hard to see the pasta.My other guest had their lasagna which looked great.We will be back next visit to Chicago.
This is hands down the best Italian food I have ever had in my life. Do yourself a favor and order the chicken parm. You will not be disappointed!

Great Italian dishes.  Veal Scaloppini and Parm are fantastic.  The Chilean Sea Bass was out of this world good!  Burrata cheese app was fresh as well.  Everyone I brought here was impressed.  Great service.  Look forward to going back.
Loves this place! Food was awesome but service was even better! The owner even brought out a slice for us for my boyfriends birthday!

Start with the meatball salad.  I know it sounds weird, but it is fabulous.  We love this spot and bring our Italian afficionado friends here . . . A perfect spot to bring out of towners and impress them with fabulous, down home, amazing Italian food.  Drinks are good and generous, food is wonderful and generous, waitstaff is always warm, welcoming and generous.
Great local place for comfort food! Amazing service! We love walking down the street and sitting outside on a sunny day. Our favorite dish is the Brick Chicken.
The most incredible Italian restaurant in Chicago! Awesome environment and outstanding food! I love the owner and staff!

Had dinner at Viaggio's last night and walked away totally disappointed. The restaurant  squeezes a lot of tables into a small space,  so its very noisy and hard to carry on a conversation with your dinner companions.    My friend and I were seated at a table for two --  the table itself  was so small that the dinner plates,  silverware and glasses were in constant peril of being knocked off the table by passing wait staff or by simple movements like putting a glass on and off the table.    The mixed green salad as a first course was okay,  but nothing special. The veal entree was a major disappointment given the price.   The entree was so heavily sauced that it looked like a jar of  marinara sauce had been dumped on the dinner plate.   As a result,  the veal and vegetables that were buried under the sauce had absolutely no flavor.    Plus,  the veal was overcooked and on the tough side.   I've had similar veal entrees at other Italian restaurants (and I'm not talking Olive Garden) that were flavorful and melt in your mouth tender.  I ended up not eating most of the entree,  instead filling up on the bread that comes with the dinner.    If you're going to an event at the United Center I suppose this would be an okay option if you don't want to eat from the UC concessions stands.    But I don't think the quality of the entrees matches up with the prices charged.     Perhaps a good place for drinks and appetizers if the restaurant is busy????

Where do I begin? The front door hostess was very nice, the owner operator Dave who could not be a pleasurable person or the bar staff which is extremely engaging. This place is run like a bar resturant should be run. The food is generous and very well prepared, the service is top notch and staff is appreciative of your business. Do you self a favor and stop in for for good italian food and see how a resturant operation should be ran- and say hi to Dave and tell him "Sherm" sent you!

This place is perfect for a family dinner.  We came with my family.  Party of 6.   So warm & welcoming.  Exceptional & attentive service.   The experience begins with roasted green peppers, parm & warm bread.   We started with the pesto infused burrata (special) & eggplant stack.  Both were delicious.   I had the sea bass.  It was amazing.  Moderate sized.  Perfect for my needs.   My dad had a special vegetarian preparation request.  A pasta primavera.  Healthy & tasty!  The hubs had Sunday gravy rigatoni.  Server said its their best dish.  And it lived up to the rep!  My brother in law ordered the eggplant parm.   The mom had a spinach salad.  Everyone loved their meals and can't wait to return!

Recently tried Viaggio for lunch, and I highly recommend it!   I work in the area, and have passed this place by many times as I was not sure of dress code, prices, and level of stuffiness.  To my surprise, I had no reason for concern.  Lunch menu was more than reasonably priced, casual to business crowd, and no snobs at all.   Great service from polite, pleasant staff!  I had a pasta dish, I think it was called rigatoni with Sunday pork gravy that was outstanding.  Decent portion of pasta, fall apart pieces of pork swimming in delicious gravy (sauce), and a side basket of bread.  My lunch partner had the chicken parmesan, and it was outstanding as well. The table next to us opted for the meatball sandwich, and I can't wait to go back a try one, they looked incredible.  If you have read my other reviews, you know I like a good meatball sandwich!      The atmosphere accommodates nearly anything imaginable-date night, night out with the guys/girls, special occasions, or a simple lunch with a friend or business associate.   When roaming the area for lunch, I will never pass this place up again.   Can't wait to go back!

The host, bartender, Julie, and our server, Matt were outstanding - friendly and accommodating.  Everyone at the table ordered something different and we were all very happy.  Would definitely go back.

Oh, the parpadelle! Everyone has had that moment where they wish their stomach was a bottomless pit to enjoy every morsel of a meal. This was one of those moments for me. I ordered the vodka parpadelle and I never wanted it to end. I wanted to keep eating, but my body told me I had to stop. It was creamy, rich, and the pasta was cooked perfectly, evidently homemade. It had just the right about of bite and the sauce coated each noodle. I'm salivating... If you do one thing when you come to Viaggio, it's order the parpadelle with vodka sauce. I finally found my favorite and it's in a city I don't live in. *single tear slides down my cheek*  Other things you must try include the meatball salad, it seems unusual, but it makes sense when you eat it.
